channel.title: Politics - Digg
channel.description: Politics on Digg: the best articles, videos, tweets, and original content that the web is talking about right now

item.title: Trump Impersonator Thinks He's Figured Out Who's Responsible For The Lockdown Crisis
item.description: Is Zoom behind the coronavirus lockdowns? Trump has a theory.

item.title: How Coronavirus Testing Fumbles Squandered Valuable Time
item.description: As coronavirus test kits were malfunctioning in public health labs across the country, Dr. Robert Redfield repeatedly assured his fellow task force officials in February that the problem would be quickly solved.

item.title: How Did Ellen DeGeneres Become One Of The Biggest Villains Of 2020?
item.description: Recently, and not for the first time, the comedian's public persona has appeared to be at odds with her private actions.

item.title: The Coronavirus Revealed America's Failures
item.description: The coronavirus didn't break America. It revealed what was already broken.

item.title: Steve Mnuchin Thinks The Economy Will Bounce Back In 'Months.' That's Very Unlikely
item.description: The treasury secretary's sunny predictions are at odds with mainstream economic forecasting.

item.title: Protesting For The Right To Catch The Coronavirus
item.description: The reopen America protests are the logical conclusion of a twisted liberty movement.

item.title: 'Nothing To Worry About' And 'It's Being Contained': How Trump Officials Downplayed The Coronavirus
item.description: A timeline of how Trump officials, like new White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany, downplayed the coronavirus well into March.

item.title: A Key GOP Strategy: Blame China. But Trump Goes Off Message
item.description: Republicans increasingly believe that elevating China's culpability for spreading the coronavirus may be the best way to improve their difficult election chances. The president is muddying the message.

item.title: MAGA World Finds Its Coronavirus Scapegoats
item.description: Vocal Trump supporters have chosen who to blame: the World Health Organization, Bill Gates and Dr. Anthony Fauci.

item.title: My Wild, Totally Surreal Experience Covering A Trump Coronavirus Briefing
item.description: Watching President Donald Trump and his task force in person was enormously revealing.

item.title: Time To Fire Jared And Ivanka
item.description: Following reports that Jared Kushner and his wife Ivanka Trump ignored coronavirus guidelines and travelled from DC to the Trump golf club in Bedminster, NJ, it's time for the couple to be fired as White House officials.
item.kicker: IS THIS A JOKE TO YOU

item.title: Donald Trump's Greatest Escape
item.description: His critics assume this crisis has to take Trump down, whether for the bungled response or the economic collapse. They're missing something important: He's been training for this moment his entire life.

item.title: How South Korea Held National Elections During The Coronavirus Pandemic
item.description: South Korea's elections this week offer lessons on how to safely conduct an election amid the COVID-19 outbreak.
item.kicker: LOTS OF SANITIZER, MASKS AND GLOVES

item.title: How Facebook Works For Trump
item.description: Donald Trump won the presidency by using the social network's advertising machinery in exactly the way the company wanted. He's poised to do it again.

item.title: How Drugs Made American Warfare
item.description: From alcohol to amphetamines, a new book shows intimate links between the policing of substances and the waging of war.

item.title: Angela Merkel Explains How Coronavirus Transmission Works
item.description: The German chancellor demonstrated her scientific expertise in a speech where she explained how the country should proceed with easing lockdown measures.

item.title: Trump's Coronavirus Briefings Are Just Another Chance For Him To Break Your Brain
item.description: There's never been anything like Trump's daily White House press conferences before.

item.title: America Is About To Witness The Biggest Labor Movement It's Seen In Decades
item.description: It took 40 years and a pandemic to stir up a worker revolution that's about to hit corporate America.

item.title: Hollywood Casts A Very Flattering Light On Right-Wing White Women
item.description: In reimagining the conservative activist Phyllis Schlafly as a prestige-TV antihero, the new FX series "Mrs. America" overlooks some uncomfortable realities.

item.title: What Happens When The White House Press Secretary Is Invisible: The Short, Strange Tale Of Stephanie Grisham
item.description: In her nine months on the job, Grisham never held a White House press briefing.

item.title: Prepare For The Ultimate Gaslighting
item.description: What is about to be unleashed on American society will be the greatest campaign ever created to get you to feel normal again.

item.title: 'My Tremendous, Total Presidential Power' — Uncannily Good Trump Impersonator Has Some Words For The Governors
item.description: Trump impersonator J-L Cauvin has some friendly words for California governor Gavin Newsom — though mainly because it "makes Don Jr. upset."

item.title: This Economist Has A Radical Plan To Solve Wealth Inequality
item.description: French economist Thomas Piketty says inequality is a political choice. The solution? Wealth taxes well beyond anything dreamed up by Bernie Sanders.

item.title: Former President Obama Endorses Biden For President
item.description: Former President Barack Obama endorsed Joe Biden on Tuesday, in a video message in which he explains why he believes his former running mate is the candidate needed at this moment of crisis in America.

item.title: A Complete Timeline Of The Coronavirus Pandemic And US Response
item.description: In response to COVID-19, the US was slow to act at a time when each day of inaction mattered most. Here's a comprehensive timeline.

item.title: After Killing Investigation, Bloomberg News Sought To Silence Reporter's Wife
item.description: The investigation into Chinese political elites would "wipe out everything we've tried to build there," Matthew Winkler, Bloomberg's editor-in-chief at the time, said on audiotape obtained by NPR.

item.title: CBS Reporter Paula Reid Impressively Grills Donald Trump On The Government's Response To COVID-19
item.description: When confronting the president about the administration's belated response to COVID-19, Reid pressed on and was unfazed by Trump's charged reactions.

item.title: Democrats Scramble To Close YouTube Deficit Amid Quarantine Campaign
item.description: Concerned Democrats compare the right's advantage on YouTube to its dominance of talk radio.

item.title: The Authoritarian Trade-Off
item.description: Exchanging privacy rights for public health is a false compromise.
item.kicker: ONE OF THESE THINGS IS NOT LIKE THE OTHER

item.title: How Coronavirus Will Blow Up The 2020 Campaign
item.description: No conventions. No rallies. No get-out-the-vote. Insiders are starting to rethink how politics is even going to work.

item.title: Why Biden's Polling Lead Vs. Trump Isn't As Solid As It Looks
item.description: Consider two important measurement differences: battleground states versus other states, and registered voters versus likely voters.

item.title: '60 Minutes' Responds Perfectly To White House Trade Adviser Peter Navarro's Challenge Towards Its Media Bias In Pandemic Coverage
item.description: During a tense interview, Navarro challenged CBS correspondent Bill Whitaker: "Show me that episode, then you'll have some credence in terms of attacking the Trump administration for not being prepared." "60 Minutes" responded to that challenge and brought the receipts.

item.title: How Mitch McConnell Became Trump's Enabler-In-Chief
item.description: The Senate Majority Leader'sÂ refusal to rein in the President is looking riskier than ever.

item.title: He Could Have Seen What Was Coming: Behind Trump's Failure On The Virus
item.description: An examination reveals the president was warned about the potential for a pandemic but that internal divisions, lack of planning and his faith in his own instincts led to a halting response.

item.title: A Sexual Assault Allegation Against Joe Biden Has Ignited A Firestorm Of Controversy
item.description: A woman says Biden assaulted her in 1993 and has filed a criminal complaint.

item.title: 8 Key Exchanges on the Faltering Response to the Coronavirus
item.description: Experts inside and outside the government identified the threat early on and sought to raise alarms even as President Trump was moving slowly. Read some of what they had to say among themselves at critical moments.

item.title: Trump Leaves Trail Of Unmet Promises In Coronavirus Response
item.description: For several months, President Donald Trump and his officials have cast a fog of promises meant to reassure a country in the throes of the coronavirus pandemic. Trump and his team haven't delivered on critical ones.

item.title: He Could Have Seen What Was Coming: Behind Trump's Failure On The Virus
item.description: An examination reveals the president was warned about the potential for a pandemic but that internal divisions, lack of planning and his faith in his own instincts led to a halting response.

item.title: Trump Spends Easter Weekend Pondering The 'Biggest Decision' Of His Presidency
item.description: President Donald Trump will watch Easter come and go this weekend without the nation "raring to go" as a new debate buds over whether May 1 is now the target date of revival.

item.title: America Might Survive The Coronavirus. But Will The Election?
item.description: The US isn't ready to hold a vote during a pandemic. It needs to get there, quickly.

item.title: Biden And Cuomo: Friends, Allies And Supporting Players No Longer
item.description: A personal friendship has grown into a crucial political alliance as the two men have emerged as pillars of the Democratic Party in a national crisis.
item.kicker: THE GREATEST PUBLIC TRIAL OF THEIR LIVES

item.title: Man Has Hilarious Reaction To Giant 'Donald Trump Bird' Landing On His Car
item.description: A cattle egret was spotted standing on top of an unsuspecting Florida man's car, prompting him to make a spot-on observation.

item.title: 'The Woman In Michigan' Goes National
item.description: Governor Gretchen Whitmer is dealing with a historic pandemic, a bullying president and a big job tryout.

item.title: America's Best Trump Impersonator Has Some Thoughts About CNN And Dr. Fauci
item.description: "Fauci stays locked up with the rest of the Keebler elves, and we don't let him out — only for Fox News."

item.title: The Two States Where Trump's COVID-19 Response Could Backfire In 2020
item.description: Voters in Michigan and Florida may be more likely than others to blame or credit him for how the outbreak unfolds.

item.title: The American Disaster Relief System Is Broken
item.description: As US federal agencies prepare to help families survive the coronavirus disaster, Hurricane Harvey's lower-income survivors offer a warning of what can go terribly wrong.

item.title: Coronavirus Response: How To Hold Elections During A Pandemic
item.description: The United States is the beacon of democracy around the world. Let's show the world that no pandemic can stop our elections.
item.kicker: CAN'T AFFORD TO MESS THIS UP

item.title: The 11 Most Logical Picks For Joe Biden's Vice President, Ranked
item.description: Biden is now the presumptive Democratic nominee. Here's who could fill out the ticket.

item.title: White House Working On Plan To Cut Aid To WHO
item.description: The White House's Office of Management and Budget is working on a possible plan for cutting US aid to the World Health Organization.

item.title: Why Bernie Sanders Lost
item.description: There is a simple explanation for why Sen. Bernie Sanders, who officially suspended his presidential campaign on Wednesday, lost the Democratic nomination: Former Vice President Joe Biden trounced the Vermont senator when the race narrowed to a one-on-one contest after Super Tuesday.
